name: Distant God Meditation
description:
"This is a dynamic zine. Paco's writing is frenetic but passionate, and has an exciting sense of rhythm and voice."

– Levi Asher, LitKicks.com


Distant God Meditation: The Poems & Rhymes of St. Paco, Year of the Dragon Edition, 2012. Like an inward reflection of the imaginative collage cover produced by the author, graffiti writer and underground publisher St. Paco, Distant God Meditation is a multi-layered manuscript that brims with the fluid poems and rhymes of a drunk, cigar-smoking monk.

name: Kung Fu Grip! Zine No. 5
description:
Kung Fu Grip! No. 5: Afro Samurai Champloo. 

Giant robots, afros, samurai, Japanese Buddhism, Lee 'Scratch' Perry, Papua New Guinea, H.R. Giger, Salvador Dali, Shiro graffiti, sticker art, toys, vintage ads, the President, The First Lady and Samuel L. Jackson! Yeah, the fifth throat-grabbing issue of Kung Fu Grip! contains all that and more!

5.5" x 8.5 black & white zine format, 56 pages.

name: Kung Fu Grip! Zine No. 3B
description:
Kung Fu Grip! No. 3B: Stick & Move – Special Edition -- no two covers are exactly the same! 

Fifty-six pages of exquisite randomness, including an 18-page pictorial on the art of "slap tagging," a sexy eulogy to Anna Nicole Smith, a one-page love story, and a piece on zine editor St. Paco's friendship with activist and author Upski Wimsatt (Bomb The Suburbs). KFG!3 also contains a graffiti gallery, vintage ads, news, toy reviews, and more.

5.5" x 8.5 black & white zine format, 56 pages.

name: Kung Fu Grip! Zine No.2
description:
Kung Fu Grip! Zine No.2: Bomb Pops & Banana Seats. 

Rockin' a fly FAFI sketch cover, KFG!2 pays 'nuff due respect to Miss Van, Fafi and Mademoiselle Kat with a sweet feature article on the French graffiti femmes. Additional features include a 30th-year memorial to the late cartoonist Vaughn Bode, an unauthorized "Cheech Wizard" comix strip by St. Paco and recognition of the 35th Anniversary of the Adidas Superstar sneaker. KFG!2 also continues to represent luvly with urban vinyl reviews, sticker art, and graffiti spreads curated by San Fran's Miss Venus (Short Cuts Zine). 

56 Pages / B&W / 5.5” x 8.5”

name: Kung Fu Grip! Zine No.1
description:
Kung Fu Grip! Zine No.1: Everybody's Talking About the Good Ol' Days. 

The inaugural issue of KFG! zine features a Black Belt Jones bootleg comic strip, a biography on Count Dante, once known as "Deadliest Man Alive," sketch art based on Ralph Bakshi's controversial R-rated toon "Street Fight" and the poignant memoir, "The Way We Were." This fantastic first issue also features a graffiti art gallery, sticker art gallery, urban vinyl toy reviews and more!

5.5" x 8.5 black & white zine format, 56 pages.
